content:
Hello there

Did you try to reinstall that version of Thunderbird?

Most of the issue s that combined this issue with Thunderbird are the most common. Are insufficient disk space. Other programs could be interfering the main program Thunderbird. Other software programs could be interrupting the possible action to use the compacting function continuous in that Thunderbird version. If are there more issue s that block or infect the software and seems to react corrupted , then it is possible to change the index file.msf this could be fixed by deleting this file. It rebuilds it itself again by restarting Thunderbird. Other subjects might be there , that there is not a possibility to compact is what kind of antivirus is used there? Is that antivirus to heavy to use with that program are there scans with the software, can you see if compacting is possible again when antivirus is turned off? Very large folder has to be shortened into normal folder capacity. These subject s can stop that Thunderbird function to compact your folder or folders.

Reporting this as a bug? Can you send me a screenshot of that message ? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-to-make-screenshots

Beta version s could not be total complete to use already. And could be solved by developers at any time , you can use the full version. And try to download from Thunderbird trusted point on the internet.


Questions are open.


Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
A Google calendar can be added to TB as a CalDAV calendar, but it doesn't include tasks. For that, you need the Provider add-on (for TB 128 - 139):

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/provider-for-google-calendar/

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/provider-for-google-calendar/reviews/1176211/

I'm not aware of task syncing with other calendar providers.

creator: t.v.teeffelen

content:
Daarvoor gelden de volgende instellingen: IMAP-instellingen Inkomende server: imap.kpnmail.nl (SSL aanvinken en poort 993 invullen) Gebruikersnaam: KPN-e-mailadres Wachtwoord: KPN-wachtwoord

Uitgaande server: smtp.kpnmail.nl (TLS aanvinken en poort 587 invullen) Gebruikersnaam: KPN e-mailadres Wachtwoord: KPN-wachtwoord

Hopelijk lukt het met deze instellingen, anders even verder kijken op https://www.kpn.com/service/ugs/geen-e-mail-ontvangen-of-versturen. Mocht het niet lukken, dan zien we graag de foutmelding (zonder privacygegevens).
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Thank you for the response. I use the Thunderbird app on my phone to manage email through my Porkbun domain. I receive all email just fine with the app. However, if I reply to an email, it appears on the app to have been sent but nothing is received on the other side. There is no error notification. I've tested this by sending my self an email from a gmail account. Then I reply to the email and I never receive the reply. If I do the same activity using Outlook on my desktop all email is sent and received. So, it seems like there is something going on with the Thunderbird app, possibly in settings, but I can't find it.

Thank you for your help.

Jeff

content: You switched from the ESR to the Monthy release. In the transition, Thunderbird didn't recognize the profile - which is still available. I think if you click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles', your profile may be there to launch. If not, then you should be able to click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder', click 'open folder', back up one folder and you will be at profiles folder. clicking that should show a second profile - your original one. Once found, you can then in Thunderbird click tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation and then follow the menu options
creator: davidsk

content:
Se vuoi procedere in inglese devi postare qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/new/thunderbird/form

A me cambia poco, ma questa sezione del forum deve essere di supporto agli utenti di lingua italiana.

--- Domanda tradotta --- Cartelle locali mancanti Cari utenti, ho installato thunderbird sul mio pc solo per aprire file .mbox contenenti archivi di anni passati. Ho letto nella guida che devo aggiungere un plugin chiamato ImportExport NG per aprire i file mbox, ma prima devo vedere le "cartelle locali", che non esistono. Ho allegato lo screenshot di thunderbird appena installato sul mio pc e lanciato. Mi mancano le "cartelle locali". Come posso risolvere? Grazie --- Fine traduzione ---

La tua domanda non è molto chiara. Mi sembra di capire che non hai Cartelle locali in Thunderbird appena installato. Questo è normale perché le Cartelle locali vengono create alla configurazione del primo account.

Vai in Tasto menu > Nuovo account e configura un account fittizio. Va bene anche uno di tipo Feed che non richiede parametri particolari.

content:
Upgrading to the Release Channel is optional. You'll still get security updates and bug fixes if you don't update. Consider the following to help you decide.

Release Channel:

- less stable

- newest features

- other improvements, e.g., graphical/functional

Note: some add-ons will not work until they are updated.

Extended Support Release Channel (ESR):

- more stable

- consistent behavior

- low maintenance

- fewer new features

See more details :

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel/

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-release/
creator: siffemoz
